intro: Haumaniastrum stanneum, commonly known as the Stannous haumaniastrum, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
